page.title: 07Nature Reserve
page.content:
The{Nature Conservancy Council}own some mud flats and woodland. It is mostly quicksand and it sometimes floods. The mud flats are gradually getting smaller. It smells awful but there are lots of butterflies.
A{Spitfire}crashed in the mud in World War Two. Also many bombs were dropped in the area as there was an important cordite factory here. Some bombs are still in the mud.
The trees are{beech, fir and silver {birch.}You have to have a special permit to get into the Reserve. There is clay under the mud. The mud goes right into Poole harbour. You can see{foxes and deer}in the woodland.
